thread.title: Drake's iTunes Bio Confirms The Weeknd Feature On "More Life"
thread.title_full: Drake's iTunes Bio Confirms The Weeknd Feature On "More Life"

author: Rose Lilah
title: Drake's iTunes Bio Confirms The Weeknd Feature On "More Life"
text:
Home > Music > Drake's iTunes Bio Confirms The Weeknd Feature On "More Life" Drake's iTunes Bio Confirms The Weeknd Feature On "More Life" 0 0 Posted by Rose Lilah , Mar 4, 2017 at 11:08am Drake's "More Life" will feature The Weeknd according to his iTunes bio. 
Drake posted-then-deleted what may be the release date for his highly anticipated More Life playlist last night- - the date was today-- while we wait on any inkling of an update regarding that, iTunes has gone ahead and confirmed some unsurprising information. 
According to Drizzy's iTunes bio, The Weeknd is a feature on More Life . The iTunes bio not only confirms a Weeknd appearance, but other past collaborators like Boi-1da and Nineteen85. The bio , written by Andy Kellman, currently reads, “ Views , was released in April and debuted at number one. It revolved lyrically around his hometown Toronto and featured production by longtime cohorts Noah “40” Shebib and Boi-1da, among others. Late that year, Drake issued another trio of singles — including the chart-topping “Fake Love”— that heralded the release of his next full-length More Life , which included collaborations with Nineteen85, The Weeknd and Maneesh Bidaye as well as Boi-1da.” 
Stay tuned for the release. < class="robots-nocontent" rel=""> Mar 4, 2017 at 11:08am 2 Views

According to Drizzy's iTunes bio, The Weeknd is a feature on More Life . The iTunes bio not only confirms a Weeknd appearance, but other past collaborators like Boi-1da and Nineteen85. The bio , written by Andy Kellman, currently reads, “ Views , was released in April and debuted at number one. It revolved lyrically around his hometown Toronto and featured production by longtime cohorts Noah “40” Shebib and Boi-1da, among others. Late that year, Drake issued another trio of singles — including the chart-topping “Fake Love”— that heralded the release of his next full-length More Life , which included collaborations with Nineteen85, The Weeknd and Maneesh Bidaye as well as Boi-1da.” 
Stay tuned for the release.
